xocs:funding-list.xocs:funding-text: Manuscript received March 24, 2018; revised June 10, 2018; accepted August 3, 2018. Date of publication August 22, 2018; date of current version March 22, 2019. This work was supported by MOST/MOE of Taiwan under Grant 105-2218-E-009-001/107W210 and National Science Foundation of USA under Grant DMS-1407557. The associate editor coordinating the review of this manuscript and approving it for publication was Prof. Faith Porikli. (Corresponding author: Heng-Wei Hsu.) H.-W. Hsu, S. Wan, and C.-Y. Lee are with the Institute of Electronics, National Chiao Tung University, Hsinchu 300, Taiwan (e-mail:, hengwzx@ si2lab.org; vjod@si2lab.org; cylee@si2lab.org).

organization.$: Institute for Computational and Mathematical Engineering

head.citation-title: Quatnet: Quaternion-based head pose estimation with multiregression loss
head.abstracts: Â© 1999-2012 IEEE.Head pose estimation has attracted immense research interest recently, as its inherent information significantly improves the performance of face-related applications such as face alignment and face recognition. In this paper, we conduct an in-depth study of head pose estimation and present a multiregression loss function, an L2 regression loss combined with an ordinal regression loss, to train a convolutional neural network (CNN) that is dedicated to estimating head poses from RGB images without depth information. The ordinal regression loss is utilized to address the nonstationary property observed as the facial features change with respect to different head pose angles and learn robust features. The L2 regression loss leverages these features to provide precise angle predictions for input images. To avoid the ambiguity problem in the commonly used Euler angle representation, we further formulate the head pose estimation problem in quaternions. Our quaternion-based multiregression loss method achieves state-of-The-Art performance on the AFLW2000, AFLW test set, and AFW datasets and is closing the gap with methods that utilize depth information on the BIWI dataset.

publisher.publishername: Institute of Electrical and Electronics Engineers Inc.

coredata.dc:description: Head pose estimation has attracted immense research interest recently, as its inherent information significantly improves the performance of face-related applications such as face alignment and face recognition. In this paper, we conduct an in-depth study of head pose estimation and present a multiregression loss function, an L2 regression loss combined with an ordinal regression loss, to train a convolutional neural network (CNN) that is dedicated to estimating head poses from RGB images without depth information. The ordinal regression loss is utilized to address the nonstationary property observed as the facial features change with respect to different head pose angles and learn robust features. The L2 regression loss leverages these features to provide precise angle predictions for input images. To avoid the ambiguity problem in the commonly used Euler angle representation, we further formulate the head pose estimation problem in quaternions. Our quaternion-based multiregression loss method achieves state-of-The-Art performance on the AFLW2000, AFLW test set, and AFW datasets and is closing the gap with methods that utilize depth information on the BIWI dataset.
coredata.dc:title: Quatnet: Quaternion-based head pose estimation with multiregression loss
